rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course type {03, 04}

description: Explore the role of language in society by examining language variation and change, multilingualism and how individuals adjust their speech to the situations they find themselves in. In this introductory unit, you will explore regional and social variation in language as well as topics such as language and gender, language and power and language policy. A key focus of this unit is the different methods of inquiry used in sociolinguistics. Students apply their insights to a range of practical situations, including surveying speakers about their language use and examining language policies in schools and workplaces.
